questions.question: What is included in the American Nurses Association's Nursing scope and standards of Practice

choices.answer: Consideration of safety and quality when delivering care.
Integration of research and Ethics in all areas of practice
The critical thinking model known as the Nursing Process

questions.question: The Nurse is beginning to experience burnout.  Which Technique is the best strategy for coping.
A nurse has a holistic understanding of the client.  Which stage of Nursing expertise is this?
The Nurses responsibilities of informed consent include all the following except?

choices.answer: documenting that the consent was obtained

questions.question: How is the Code of Ethics most useful for Nurses?

choices.answer: Gives Direction to specific cases of ethical dilemma
Gives suggestions in cases of general duty ethical dilemma
it is best used to make suggestions in critical situations
It offers guidelines for  ethical delivery of nursing care.

questions.question: What is the focus of client advocacy

choices.answer: the Nurse is responsible for the patient's health.
The Nurse should influence the patient to make a decision
The focus is respect for the client's decision and autonomy.
Emphasis is on correcting the client's reported weakness

questions.question: A Nurse asks a patient about his pain level after giving a med.  This is an example of:
This type of hospital has shareholders who invest in the facility expecting a return investment
Which law established policies and procedures to protect confidentiality of patient information

choices.answer: Health on the Net Foundation Code of Conduct
Healthcare information and management systems act
Health Insurance Portability and accountability act

questions.question: Which statement made by the Nursing student is accurate for the role of the community Nurse

choices.answer: Focus on Nursing Services to individuals, families and group
Focus on nursing services to individuals and families
Focus on nursing services to the hospitalized client
Focus on nursing to groups and organizations

questions.question: The Nurse understands the guidleines for using a interpreter for a non-English patient when she

choices.answer: Uses a family member to translate
Is aware of gender and age differences
Speaks Loudly to the patient and interpreter

choices.answer: Nurses are expected to use EBP in their decision making
